jobDescription: Job Description General Summary: Vertex is seeking a talented individual to join our small molecule Analytical Development group in Boston, MA. This role will involve strategic planning, coordination, and experimental execution within established timelines of analytical activities supporting the advancement of early phase clinical programs (Preclinical through Phase 2). Responsibilities include oversight and accountability for all assigned analytical deliverables for a program, which may include but not be limited to analytical method development and validation, purity and stability characterization, setting specifications, CMO oversight, and overall strategic alignment, for both small molecule drug substance and drug product development. jobTitle: Associate Director, Intellectual Property Counsel, Small Molecule
jobDescription: Job Description Vertex Pharmaceuticals is seeking an in-house patent lawyer to support its research and development organization. The role will primarily support Vertex's small molecule pipeline. The Associate Director will advise Vertex on a wide range of intellectual property matters, including preparation and prosecution, administrative proceedings, due diligence, and transaction support, in addition to general client counseling. The individual in this position will be highly visible and can directly contribute to Vertex’s success. The position will be based in Boston or San Diego and report to a Senior Director, Intellectual Property. The position can be either full time in the office or hybrid (3-days in the office). Key Duties And Responsibilities Manage intellectual property portfolios for small molecule candidates, including drafting and filing patent applications, responses to office actions and briefs, and assist in establishing US and International Patent strategies Conduct prior art searches, analyze third-party patent positions, and conduct due diligence to support business development activities Supporting the drafting of confidentiality agreements, material transfer agreements, and sponsored research agreements. jobTitle: Associate Director, Logistics and Distribution (Cold Chain)
jobDescription: Job Description POSITION SUMMARY: This position is the company subject matter expert on temperature-controlled (cold chain) logistics and is integral to the success of the clinical and commercial programs at Vertex. Reporting to the Global Logistics Director, this position will understand the regulatory requirements and provide expertise to help develop and implement temperature controlled (cold chain) logistics strategy globally across multiple regions, business units and functions to ensure a cGMP and GDP compliant supply chain. This role will also collaborate globally to select, design, develop, qualify, and implement temperature-controlled shipping solutions and distribution lanes. This role will manage multiple global projects to develop a harmonized, compliant, and cost-effective temperature-controlled supply chain throughout Vertex. Key Responsibilities Stay current on, and be able to apply, global regulatory requirements for temperature-controlled supply chain (e.g., cGMP, GDP, EUMDR, etc.) Initiate, lead, and implement projects required to efficiently and effectively execute the temperature-controlled logistics strategy globally ensuring cGMP and GDP compliance Design, develop, qualify, and implement cost-effective and cGMP/GDP compliant temperature-controlled packaging and shipping solutions for lane qualification and validation, aligned with global strategy Identify, select, qualify, and implement prequalified shipping systems that are cost-effective and cGMP/GDP compliant Develop and maintain a database of temperature-controlled shipping systems used and approved within Vertex by temperature range, duration, lane, etc. Bring creative and innovative ideas and keep up to date with the latest innovations in the temperature-controlled supply chain, including but not limited to shipping systems, temperature monitoring including real-time IOT Perform all duties in close collaboration with internal (business units, regions, sites, DCs, functions, etc.) and external (2PLs, 3PLs, suppliers, testing labs, etc.) partner. Support the evaluation, selection and quality audit of logistic service providers (LSPs) Work in conjunction with the Quality organization to properly document changes following the change control process. Support the Quality organization to properly address any internal and external audits questions. Performs other duties as assigned. Required Knowledge And Skills Broad knowledge of end-to-end supply chain Must be familiar with principles of qualification and validation, global regulations, and guidance documents on temperature-controlled supply chain (e.g., cGMP, GDP, USP1079, USP659, PDA-TR39, WHO, etc.) Analytical abilities required to break down complex problems and absorb complex data Ability and willingness to learn from experience and apply it to new conditions Ability to think strategically and execute tactically Creativity and innovation Interpersonal skills to be a strong and influential team member via collaboration and respect for others Proficient with Microsoft Office applications; word, excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, access, etc. Demonstrated knowledge of pharmaceutical manufacturing of biotechnology products, aseptic processing, cell therapy products and process development Practical expertise with cGMP manufacturing and regulatory regulations and requirements for pharmaceuticals and devices Has an excellent understanding of Good Distribution Practices in the Pharmaceutical Industry. Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a collaborative and fast-paced team environment, including business leadership to build alignment. Ability to influence others in sensitive or difficult situations Ability to think critically, and demonstrate troubleshooting and problem-solving skills Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills Ability to function efficiently and independently in a changing environment Familiarity with various regulations including those related to hazardous shipments, employee safety, and freight classifications Agile mindset to constantly adapt to a changing environment Minimum Requirements BS in Engineering, Supply Chain, Logistics, or related science. Master’s degree in Engineering or Supply Chain is preferred Minimum of 7 years of experience in medical device, pharmaceutical, or other life sciences industry Minimum of 5 years hands-on experience in designing, developing, and qualifying shipping systems and processes for refrigerated, frozen, and controlled room temperature products including IQ, OQ, PQ protocols and reports Minimum of 3 years’ experience in a global environment, working across multiple cultures, especially collaborating online globally Minimum of 3 years’ experience in Project Management including one-year leading complex projects Company Information Vertex is a global biotechnology company that invests in scientific innovation. Job Description This co-op position will be within the Exploratory Research group of Boston Research, utilizing cell-based studies with established techniques to assess newly-developed tools within the Chemical Biology group. In the laboratory, the student will maintain mammalian cell lines in tissue culture, plate cells for experiments, preform transient transfections with key proteins of interest, dose cells with selected small molecules, collect population-based fluorescence reporter measurements and fix/stain cells for cell-by-cell fluorescence assessment. The student will also be responsible for maintaining thorough documentation, analyzing data and reporting conclusions. A successful project will result in a determination of the feasibility of a specific application of a novel approach to treating the underlying cause of genetically defined disease. It is essential that a student in this position have independent mammalian cell culture experience, as well as some undergraduate research experience. Preference will be given to candidates with familiarity with immunofluorescence or transfection techniques, as well as experience running experiments in high-density plates and/or utilizing laboratory automation. The successful candidate will be integrated into a larger team evaluating parallel approaches, will contribute to discussions on the overall project and will gain valuable laboratory, research and professional experience that will be broadly applicable to research positions within the pharmaceutical industry. Key Responsibilities Maintain multiple mammalian cell lines within culture and plate cells into high-density plates for fluorescence-based assays Become proficient in additional cell culture techniques, including plasmid transfections, cell fixation and utilization of automation equipment With minimal oversight, run weekly cell-based assays including plating, transfection, dosing and imaging as well as data collection, analysis, interpretation, documentation and reporting Contribute to broader team discussions, propose new ideas/insights and assist in supportive laboratory and/or analytical work as needed Develop into a contributing team member within the Exploratory Research group Minimum Qualifications Be within one year of completing undergraduate, masters or Ph.D. in a biology-based program Have practical and independent hands-on laboratory experience including in vitro cell work (mammalian cell culture preferred) Some academic and/or industry research experience Strong interest in disease biology/therapeutic development Self-motivated with a strong foundation in a biology-related discipline to produce meaningful, accurate and timely results when working semi-independently Must have rigorous attention to detail and be able to adapt to a fast-paced environment  Strong verbal and written communication skills are essential Alignment with Vertex core values Preferred Qualifications Undergraduate candidates should have a strong demonstrated record of hands-on laboratory experience and data processing Graduate candidates should have a demonstrated record of increasing scientific independence History of publication ICC data, particularly image quantification Familiarity with automation and robotic instrumentation (BioTek, Momentum, IMX, Phenix or similar) Experience running data analysis pipelines (CellProfiler, GeneData, MetaXPress or similar) Company Information Vertex is a global biotechnology company that invests in scientific innovation. Job Description General Summary: The Director, Clinical Trial Management is responsible for the planning, oversight, and execution of study and program-level deliverables across a range of study phases within one or more therapeutic areas to ensure corporate goals are met. This role often has responsibility for complex therapeutic areas with multiple compounds under simultaneous clinical development. Manages Clinical Trial Managers with responsibility for recruitment, resourcing, training, performance management, employee goal setting and career development. May also manage contract staff. Proven track record of successfully overseeing staff to execute and deliver clinical trials on time and on budget, ensuring inspection readiness throughout. jobTitle: Director, Product Quality Cystic Fibrosis Portfolio
jobDescription: Job Description GENERAL POSITION SUMMARY: Position Summary The Director of Product Quality is accountable for end-to-end quality oversight of the small CF portfolio throughout clinical development, commercialization, filing, approval, launch, and post approval lifecycle management activities. This oversight includes setting and maintaining overall Quality strategies in support of commercialization efforts including establishing relevant product quality standards for current or novel technologies (including devices where applicable), ensuring internal and cross-functional alignment with industry and regulatory expectations, identifying product quality risks and mitigations throughout development of the assigned program. The candidate should have a good understanding of drug development and commercialization and be able to partner effectively with business stakeholders in development functions (i.e., process development, analytical development, manufacturing science and technology, site QA/QC, and regulatory CMC) to enable a robust product development (QbD) approach that considers technical, regulatory, and quality / compliance considerations per cGMP regulation. The candidate will ensure a robust supply chain and support product launch activities per program needs. The Director, Quality leader will foster strong collaboration and partnership with external and internal stakeholders, and the international Quality leadership team. This individual will provide strategic guidance and direction to the integrated benchmarking and external environmental monitoring for identifying emerging industry trends and best practices to facilitate maximum value to evaluation of the health of the quality system. This individual will demonstrate Vertex Core Values, as well as model leadership behaviors instilling a culture of quality, engagement, development, and transparency. Responsibilities Provide clearly defined Quality expectations, Quality strategy, and Quality deliverables for assigned program within the Cystic Fibrosis small molecule portfolio, including in-licensed and outsourced products, as part of commercialization and product lifecycle management. Develop, approve, and maintain critical Quality standards and control requirements for products and processes (e.g., stage gate deliverable), working in collaboration with key internal and external stakeholders, embedding the principles of product lifecycle and Quality by Design. Ensure quality and compliance frameworks, guidance, and systems are in place to keep them current with general industry and health authority expectations as well as Vertex’s QMS. Critically evaluate new products and processes with respect to Quality and compliance requirements. Work with development functions and supply chain to improve manufacturing processes, new product introduction standards, and overall program strategy and keep them current with global regulatory expectations and internal Vertex standards, integrating the scientific intent of the technical SMEs and clinical phase-appropriate approaches, as applicable. Proactively identify Quality risks and improvement opportunities for the assigned program(s) across all stages of manufacturing and across all drug product presentations in support of commercialization. Ensure that the identified risks, mitigations, and possible improvements are understood by CMC development team stakeholders by working with project teams and stakeholders to mitigate them during clinical development, validation, submission, and launch. Ensure significant Quality risks are escalated per the company procedure and properly mitigated in a timely manner by working with the cross-functional/site teams. Champion a consistent approach to Quality and compliance standards across manufacturing sites, recognizing the wider implications of Quality-related issues, including the implementation of the principles of Quality by Design and new and emerging regulatory guidance. May serve as a single point of Quality contact for new product introduction and work with the PAI readiness team for the assigned product(s) on the Chemistry, Manufacturing, and Controls (CMC) product and/or project governance teams covering Analytical Development, Process Development, Technical Operations, and Supply Chain topics for GMP/GDP clinical trial materials and commercial products to ensure a global Quality strategy is developed and maintained for consistency and standardization (to the extent it is practical). Chair/Lead in appropriate governance meetings for Quality members to critically review proposed complex changes (e.g., multi-product or multi-site), promoting a risk-based approach to change control approvals. Ensure/facilitate effective bi-directional communication between the Quality groups and cross-functional teams and ensuring standardized processes (e.g., new product introduction, risk assessments, technology transfers, etc.) are used across sites. Support preparation of CMC clinical and commercial regulatory submissions by critically reviewing and approving relevant documents per team timeline and associated HA questions on the filing. Support device development for combination products (as needed) by taking part in design history file reviews, strategy, risk identification, and risk mitigation. Define resource allocation for network of QA resource assignment for his/her/their assigned products. Basic Qualifications A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree (or University equivalent) is required with a major or concentration in one of the following: Pharmacy, Biology, Biochemistry, Biotechnology, Engineering, or a similar technical/scientific degree concentration. A Master of Science degree in pharmaceutical, chemical background, biological necessary or a similar degree concentration is desirable. A minimum of 5 years of deep and broad experience in a technical, quality, and/or regulatory role within the pharmaceutical/biopharmaceutical industry in product development and associated project management and governance is required. Key areas of preferred expertise are: API/DP manufacturing, process validation, specification setting, control strategy setting, regulatory submission authoring. A minimum of 3 years in directly managing staff and/or leadership experience in leading teams, projects, programs, or directing allocation of resources is preferred. Previous experience on a Site Leadership Team or R&D Leadership Team is strongly preferred. Expertise in cGMP compliance, FDA guidelines, and international guidelines dealing with pharmaceutical manufacturing and Quality Assurance, quality standards, policies and procedures is required. In-depth understanding of quality processes/systems (e.g., change control, event handling, CAPA), risk management and manufacturing control strategies is preferred. Experience in the practicalities of implementing cGMP guidelines, ICH Q8/9/10/11, PAT/ASTM guidance, etc. Demonstrated application of the principles of cGMP and Quality Assurance. Direct experience with regulators (e.g., NDA, BLA, MAA submissions and/or inspections) is strongly preferred. Proven leadership ability to carry out difficult decisions and demonstrated ability to work as a senior management team member. Demonstrated influential leadership experienced in operating in a matrix organization (across boundaries) with Technical, Supply Chain and Regulatory functional areas through presenting, influencing, negotiation and partnering is required. Capable of building alignment across diverse perspectives and functional areas. Working knowledge of the application of statistical techniques to Quality processes. Demonstrated strategic thinking capability with strong project management skills and ability to focus on execution of strategic decisions Experience in technology transfer, process development and/or process validation is preferred. Experience in API and Drug Product stability is a plus. This position will be in Boston or Cambridge, MA and may require domestic and international travel as business demands. Job Description Vertex Pharmaceuticals is seeking a highly motivated and experienced structural biologist and biophysicist to lead and further develop the existing Protein Sciences Team. This team is responsible for all gene to structure work as well as cell-based approaches to study the mechanism of action of new and existing therapies. The team already has a strong track record in applying these approaches to drug discovery. The Director, Protein Sciences has an impressive history of accomplishments which contribute signiﬁcantly to the advancement of projects, and is recognized internally as an emerging thought leader, acknowledged throughout the company as expert in innovative design, generation, and testing of proteins to enable the study of structure-function relationships for disease-relevant targets. He/she applies superior acumen in identifying project needs that are bolstered by reﬁned, systematic creativity and strong judgment of when to launch efforts on a new trajectory. Key Duties & Responsibilities Lead a team of 2-3 scientists and set a strategic, scientific, and operational direction to deliver mechanism-of-action and structural biology insights to advance drug discovery projects. Propose, coordinate, and implement cell-based and protein-based biochemical/biophysical/structural studies to support lead generation and optimization. Build cross-functional partnerships and apply an integrative/cutting-edge scientific approach to identify and advance new therapeutic targets and therapeutic approaches for new and existing diseases. Support Vertex to continually strengthen internal technology capabilities and exploit external centers of excellence. Integrate and collaborate with related functions in Boston and Oxford and represent Vertex within the wider community in strategic partnerships. Propose and implement novel and improved data analysis tools. Maintain the excellence of standards for structure and interpretation of all laboratory records, electronic database entries, internal reports, patents, and external communications from the team. Drive projects forward in a fast-paced environment Experience & Education Requirements Ph.D. (or equivalent degree) in cellular biology, biochemistry, biophysics, or related disciplines and 9+ years of relevant post-doctoral employment experience, or Masters Degree (or equivalent degree) in cellular biology, biochemistry, biophysics, or related disciplines and 12+ years of relevant employment experience, or Bachelors Degree (or equivalent degree) in cellular biology, biochemistry, biophysics, or related disciplines and 15+ years of relevant employment experience Established reputation with a strong track record of scientific impact in driving drug discovery programs forward by initiating and implementing protein biochemistry, biophysics, protein mechanism of action and structure/function studies. Experience can come from functional or cross-functional project leadership roles. Experience with integral membrane proteins is highly desirable. Experience in RNA biochemistry and RNA structural biology Experience in managing small scientific teams, personnel performance, goal setting and career growth development Demonstrated independent thought/creativity in science, leadership skills, and ability to inspire and motivate teams. Excellent communication (oral and written) in articulating goals, objectives and results to the group and larger cross-functional project teams Extensive experience interfacing with internal and external stakeholders to collaborate and execute on research programs, deliver results, and influence decision making Ability to navigate and be successful in a fast-paced, innovative, and multi-disciplinary work environment Company Information Vertex is a global biotechnology company that invests in scientific innovation. Lead continual service improvement and ongoing process maturity through regular reviews of the process and tools, trend analysis and metrics reporting and through regular engagement with business stakeholders and DTE leadership team. jobTitle: Drug Metabolism and Pharmacokinetics, Modeling & Simulations Co-op
jobDescription: Job Description The Vertex Summer Co-op Program offers students the opportunity to learn about the pharmaceutical industry from a hands-on perspective. The Co-op will be working closely with and learning from some of the brightest people in the industry. The Drug Metabolism & Pharmacokinetics (DMPK) group in Boston is seeking an innovative Co-op in the modeling team. Our team relies very much on understanding quantitative relationships that define disease biology, disease progression and drug mechanisms and dynamics. The Co-op will be given real-world translational modeling and simulation problems to tackle with close guidance of DMPK modelers and scientists. Be RELENTLESS... Join us and help kick start the path to your career! Co-op Program: (January to June) Full Time, 40 Hours/Week Key Responsibilities The Co-op will work closely with Vertex DMPK scientists to enable the development of fit-for-purpose in-house mechanistic pharmacokinetics-pharmacodynamics models for our research projects. Example problems include 1) construct PKPD relationship to determine in-vivo model efficacy predictor for small molecule rare disease programs 2) explore the effect on PK from certain disease populations and considerations for dose and regimen adjustment 3) build NLME models for generating unbiased parameter estimates. Exercises like these will better enable our ability to study PK related drug-drug interaction issues and PD effects. Qualifications Candidate must be enrolled in an undergraduate degree program in one of the following areas: Mathematics, computer science, engineering, or other computational discipline with a passion for pharmaceutical sciences, or vice-versa. Have good knowledge and experience in data science, applied statistics and ODE-based system biology/pharmacology modeling. Hands on experience with Matlab, R, Python, or other programming language is required. Basic knowledge of the science of drug metabolism and pharmacokinetics (Absorption, Distribution, Metabolism and Excretion) is preferred. jobTitle: Executive Medical Director, Pain Global Medical Lead
jobDescription: Job Description The Global Medical Lead, Pain is responsible for developing the North America and Global Medical Strategy plan. This role is accountable for developing the Pain medical strategy, insight gathering, and tactical planning (including medical congress activity, medical materials, and training, and thought leader engagement). This role will work closely with both the internal development team and project team and collaborate with the commercial and development teams to align with the disease and brand priorities. The role includes leading the Global Medical Area Team (GMAT) for Pain, which brings together representatives across medical functions, including RWE, HEOR, Medical Information, and regional medical to build and endorse Global and North America Medical Strategy. Additionally, this role interacts regularly with multiple Global Medical Affairs functions, including regional and country medical colleagues, Medical Communication, Medical Information, Publications, Grants, Investigator Initiated Studies, as well as multiple other internal functions including Commercial (marketing, sales), Regulatory, Clinical Development, Biometrics, and Safety. The GML is the Medical Representative at the Disease Strategy Team (DST) that is responsible for the strategy for the disease area. Key Responsibilities Develops Global and North America medical affairs plans, including launch and Life Cycle Management plans. Critically interprets scientific data and determines the potential impact of new research on medical thinking and practice and uses scientific and clinical data to formulate frameworks and disease management approaches, the main objective of which is to ensure that patients receive appropriate care and achieve the best possible long-term health outcomes. Collaborates with the development team in the implementation of the late phase clinical development trials. Ensure country/regional insights and needs are considered in global strategies and activities by leading the GMAT. Serves as Medical Affairs representative on the DST and Project Team (PT). Partners to develop and deliver high quality Phase IIIB/IV studies to support reimbursement and access needs and appropriate use of the medicines Provides medical support for the preparation of the Global Value Dossiers and support the Country Medical Directors for the preparation of local reimbursement dossiers and hearings. Provides scientific input and expertise in the design and construction of Global promotional materials and events. She/he serves as the primary medical reviewer and approver of Global promotional materials. Establishes strong relationships and scientific communication with External Experts and Patient Advocacy groups in Pain. Represents Vertex at external meetings, such as Advisory Boards and medical conferences. Participate in the review meetings of the Global Grant Committee and provide support to the IIS review for Pain. Perform/oversee medical/scientific training to Commercial and other internal stakeholders Provide medical Intelligence and support at relevant medical congress meetings. Assure compliance with laws, regulations and applicable codes. Skills And Experience MD degree, with specialty in an area that manages acute and/or chronic pain. ≥15 years of experience in the biotechnology or pharmaceutical industry, with ≥7 in Medical Affairs; including experience working with thought leaders and direct involvement in promotional and medical materials review. Medical Affairs experience in the Pain disease area is desirable. Excellent communication skills and proven ability to effectively present complex medical information to others Strong relationship-forming capabilities. Ability to work across multiple functions and to be effective in a matrix environment. Team oriented, strong interpersonal skills, ability to collaborate with other groups. Creative, ability to see the big picture without losing focus on specific tactical needs. Strong negotiation and persuasion skills. Job Description The Vertex Summer Co-op Program offers students the opportunity to learn about the pharmaceutical industry from a hands-on perspective. You will be working closely with and learning from some of the brightest people in the industry. When you join our co-op program you should not be surprised to see that our environment is one that is innovative and team oriented, where collaboration is not just a word, and "we are relentless" is in everything we do. Students can expect to be challenged by their summer project plan, connect with other co-ops, and feel valued by the Vertex community. Not only will co-ops learn about their day-to-day tasks through their specific work assignments, but they will interact and have exposure to our organizational leaders and their teams through a series of Professional Development Workshops. Be RELENTLESS... Join us and help kick start the path to your career! Co-op Program: (January-June), Full Time, 40 Hours/Week Vertex Pharmaceuticals is working to discover and develop innovative genetic therapies with the potential to provide transformative benefit to patients. Vertex is currently advancing multiple CRISPR-based genetic therapies that have the potential to cure or stop the progression of degenerative and neuromuscular diseases. This internship will provide a fantastic opportunity to work on cutting edge science, apply state-of-the-art gene editing technologies, and take part in discovering and developing next-generation therapies for Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy and other genetic disorders. The internship will be undertaken at Vertex Cell and Genetic Therapies, in a highly dynamic and competitive environment. The overarching goal of this research is to evaluate gene editing efficiency at multiple disease genomic loci and to create an in vitro model system for screening and delivery of next-generation therapeutic approaches. The proposed project will establish robust in vitro functional assays for the characterization of muscle cells following differentiation of patient-derived iPSCs. We will initially focus on the characterization of muscle fiber maturity through analysis of a panel of muscle markers, as well as methods for therapeutic asset delivery and functional readouts in muscle cells including contractility and calcium imaging. The successful candidate will be exposed to a broad range of advanced technologies including CRISPR-Cas9 genome engineering, iPS cell culture and differentiation systems, and advanced microscopy imaging. Key Responsibilities Perform cell culture experiments to generate muscle cells from iPSCs Assess differentiation efficiency and functional readouts of induced muscle tissues Document experimental procedures and findings in an accurate and timely manner Present results and conclusions to team members Qualifications Applicants must be enrolled in a College/University in a Biology/Biochemistry/Biomedical Sciences major or related field High level of verbal and written communication skills Ability to interact cross-functionally with multiple team members Strong Analytical Capabilities And Problem Solving Skills Previous hands-on experience with cell culture is a strong plus Working knowledge of MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) Company Information Vertex is a global biotechnology company that invests in scientific innovation. Job Description The Senior Manager of Global Trade Compliance will support Vertex commercial, clinical supply chains, research & development and other activities by ensuring the uninterrupted, compliant and efficient movement of product across Vertex’s global drug supply chain, clinical and research networks. Job Description This individual will have a primary focus on US/CA import and export trade operations and particularly on non-commercial sample and analytical shipments. jobTitle: Investigative Toxicology Lead Principal Research Scientist
jobDescription: Job Description Vertex Pharmaceuticals uses cutting edge science and technologies to create transformative therapies for the treatment of the most serious diseases with unmet medical need. Our culture enables individual empowerment where “We Wins” “Fearless Pursuit of Excellence” and “Innovation” are more than just corporate values: They are part of our everyday lives. Preclinical Safety Assessment is a global function responsible for the design and execution of preclinical strategies for the comprehensive safety assessment of Vertex therapies at all stages of discovery and development, beginning in the early drug discovery phases and continuing through the entire drug development value chain resulting in registration and marketing. The Predictive and Investigative Safety Assessment (PISA) group is seeking candidates with a strong desire to be part of a highly innovative company aimed at transforming the lives of people with serious diseases, their families and society. This role will be located at our research site in San Diego, CA, and will serve as an integral member of PISA through the evaluation, integration, and application of conventional & complex model systems for investigations arising from target knowledge and toxicity issues during the drug discovery & development process. The Investigative Toxicology Lead will establish and lead in vitro investigative toxicity studies through the design and supervision of scientific and technical activities and serve as a representative of PISA on project teams. The Investigative Toxicology Lead will be responsible for communicating investigative plans and updates to PISA LT and PSA leadership. The ideal candidate will have both a life sciences and computational background, enabling them to support the development and execution of a new transcriptomics data modelling strategy for the PISA group, to predict specific organ toxicities. This role will provide the individual with an excellent opportunity to work closely with both San Diego research and global Preclinical Safety Assessment colleagues, and to make a significant impact. Key Responsibilities Establish in vitro toxicology experimental and investigative capabilities to primarily support the San Diego portfolio. Establish a culture of ownership and deep scientific involvement and build strong cross-functional collaborations between Pre-clinical Safety Assessment and research project teams in San Diego to address toxicological questions and issues. Along with the global functional leadership, assist in developing the multisite strategy for Predictive and Investigative Safety Assessment and implement this strategy by leveraging novel and established technologies to deliver efficient de-risking and investigational endpoints for current therapeutic leads. Leads and oversees development and implementation of novel assay platforms and approaches to support early safety assessment and issue resolution, guided by previous experience and advanced judgement to anticipate potential outcomes and appropriate follow-up. Independently designs, executes, and reports complex experiments to address emerging issues in early and investigative safety assessment and oversees execution of experimental plans by peers, junior lab staff, CROs, and other external partners. Maintain cellular and molecular biology expertise through internal and external collaborations, continuing education, and publications. Strong desire to mentor and supervise staff to support growth of investigative capabilities. Interact with strategic outsourcing partners to design and execute toxicology studies to meet specific project needs. Effectively communicate critical and significant project information to various bodies including project teams and Vertex leadership as required. Build strong scientific collaborations with external groups within both the academic and industrial sectors with the intent of enhancing Vertex’s discovery toxicology capabilities. Collaborate on design and execution of investigative and systems toxicology studies in support of development compounds. Education And Experience Ph.D. in life sciences with a strong molecular & cellular biology and computational focus. 4+ years in the Pharmaceutical or related industry with proven abilities within Drug Discovery. Strong and demonstrable interpersonal skills with an ability to develop solid, long-term relationships and to influence others. Experience with novel assay development and big data. Proven scientific acumen with the ability to creatively seek resolutions to toxicological issues. Strong problem solver who is highly organized with the ability to thrive and lead in a matrixed work environment with rapidly changing priorities. Working knowledge of cross-disciplinary drug discovery. Company Information Vertex is a global biotechnology company that invests in scientific innovation. Job Description In June 2019, Vertex announced the establishment of a new research site in the Boston area where research, development, and clinical manufacturing for cell and genetic therapies will be primarily based. jobTitle: Molecular Biology Research Scientist, AAV Research
jobDescription: Job Description General Overview: The AAV Research team at Vertex Cell and Genetic Therapies (VCGT) optimizes AAV as gene delivery platform for human genetic therapies. We are seeking a highly motivated, self-driven, and independent molecular biologist to join our mission of developing best-in-class gene therapy. This role will use state-of-the-art genetic engineering, cell engineering technologies, and OMICS platforms to study mechanism-of-action of engineered AAV capsids and their translatability therein. The incumbent candidate will have a strong technical expertise in molecular biology, PCR-based assay development (qPCR and/or ddPCR), mammalian cell engineering by CRISPR/Cas9, and transcriptomics data analysis. The ideal candidate will have a working knowledge of human genetics, gene therapy, virology, and pharmacology. This position collaborates with cross-functional teams at multiple Vertex sites. Job Description Vertex is seeking a talented individual to join the Pharmaceutical Science data science group in Boston, MA. The successful candidate will be a highly productive, results-oriented individual, able to multi-task and generate and implement original ideas that contribute to the successful implementation of advanced data science solutions to pharmaceutical development. Strong communication, organization, and planning skills and a high level of technical aptitude and creativity are required for success in this position. The successful candidate will help lead the digital transformation of work processes across the Pharmaceutical Science department, including Process Chemistry, Engineering & Materials Science, Formulation and Analytical Development, via a partnership with Vertex’s Data Technology and Engineering/IT group. This role will focus on working with lab-based functions to define needs; design supporting data science, analytics, modelling, and visualization solutions; and oversee implementation and lifecycle management. The core focus of this role is to enable a structured digital transformation and digitizing of the Pharm Sci value chain – utilizing digital approaches to increase organizational capability, deliver efficiencies, improve operational robustness, enable data-driven decisions, and foster a “digital culture” that ultimately contributes to the rapid delivery of high quality therapies to patients across the globe. Analyze existing workflows and translate into clear user requirements that can be digested by teams working on building and developing digital products in an agile framework. Job Description Vertex is seeking a talented individual to join our Analytical Development team in Boston, MA. Consistently and passionately challenging the boundaries of their knowledge, our Analytical Development team employs traditional and innovative analytical techniques and Quality-by-Design principles to ensure the safety, efficacy and quality of Vertex pharmaceutical products. This position provides a unique opportunity to contribute to drug product development in a dual role as a member of both the Process Analytics and Control team and the Dissolution team. The Process Analytics and Control team is responsible for the automated control strategy for drug product continuous manufacturing and the development/validation of PAT methods. Specific responsibilities include compliance to cGMPs, the development and validation of Process Analytical Techniques (PAT) methods and data models, statistical data analysis including the justification for sampling plans, Monte Carlo simulations, etc., and the evaluation of new technology to support Formulation Development, Continuous GMP Manufacturing and Real Time Release Testing (RTRT). As a member of the Dissolution team this role will also support the drug development programs at Vertex through analytical method development, validation, and transfer. This person will have the opportunity to support the development and execution of analytical strategies for phase appropriate dissolution methods and specification justifications. Applicants are not expected to have expertise in all aspects of both process analytics and dissolution testing but should have a strong background in analytical chemistry, chemical engineering, or pharmaceutical chemistry and the ability to grow and develop within the opportunities presented in this role. Both strong analytical technical capabilities and excellent communication skills are required to be successful in this role. Key Responsibilities PAT responsibilities: Supporting the development of PAT methods (multivariate data analysis and spectroscopic methods) and data models to support unit manufacturing operations. Supporting the implementation of PAT methods/models for real time in-process controls and real time release testing. Supporting the implementation of automated control strategies to support continuous GMP manufacturing including configuration, bench testing, integrated script testing, report development, and report validation. Supporting GMP continuous manufacture, including leading PAC activities in support of clinical manufacturing. Qualification and maintenance of PAT equipment. Dissolution Responsibilities Supporting analytical method development, validation, and transfer. Develops, troubleshoots, and conducts analytical experiments in support of drug substance/product process development within SOPs and regulations. Collates and interprets complex analytical data systematically, and compiles results into a cohesive body of conclusions or recommendations to guide Project decisions and new analytical activities. Authors methods, protocols and reports as assigned Maintains accurate records of experiments and results in an electronic laboratory notebook. Demonstrates knowledge of scientific principles and basic understanding of applicable drug development regulations Minimum Qualifications A Bachelor's degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or Pharmaceutical Chemistry and 5+ years (Bachelors) or 2+ years (Masters) relevant analytical experience Knowledge and experience in one or more analytical techniques (e.g. Spectroscopic techniques, particle size measurement, HPLC/UPLC, Dissolution testing, KF, etc.) Excellent experimental documentation. Excellent attention to detail and strong communication skills. The ability to work successfully in both a team/matrix environment as well as independently. The ability to work in a fast-paced environment, manage priorities, and maintain timelines for multiple projects. Job Description General Summary: The Principal Manufacturing Systems Engineer will be a technical resource in ensuring delivery and support of commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) systems for lab and manufacturing business partners. The Business Engagement & Technology Principal Analyst will partner with business to deliver digitally integrated manufacturing and lab capabilities. The candidate should be experienced with automated manufacturing equipment, robotics, laboratory instrumentation and scientific software and be comfortable working directly with operators, analysts, engineers, and scientists in a highly dynamic and innovative pharmaceutical company. This role represents the highest hands-on level of support for commercial and custom-developed equipment as well as lifecycle ownership of computer related systems for data acquisition and analysis. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to contribute high impact and strategic activities in the manufacturing and lab technology landscape. Additionally, the Business Engagement & Technology Principal Analyst will maintain reliable, secure and compliant systems that easily meet business needs by efficient delivery, maintenance and enhancements. Key Duties And Responsibilities Become a trusted partner of the business leaders within their remit, understand their needs and vision, and deliver technology solutions to support and enable their goals and objectives. Help refine and execute the technology strategy by leading implementation, integration and ongoing maintenance of technology solutions. Implement configured/custom software and workflow solutions for process operations, data acquisition, sample management or lab analysis. Work closely with DTE Compliance, Internal Audit, and Quality Assurance groups as needed to ensure compliance with all appropriate regulations and data integrity expectations, as well as DTE system lifecycle and change management requirements. Work independently and as a team member to research, configure and diagnose equipment and system failures and triage with vendors as needed. Support the technical integration of process equipment and benchtop analyzers with enterprise data systems. Ensure that the design and implementation of the service is consistent and supportive of the Vertex security architecture, data integrity and data protection standards based on documented requirements and identified technical, compliance and business risks. Ensure requirements, procedures and technical specifications are documented in the appropriate SLC deliverables and / or CMDB. Participate in the computer system validation (CSV) planning and execution of the solutions, authoring and / or contributing to key CSV deliverables. Participate in the assessment, approval, and implementation of changes according to Vertex change management processes and procedures. Lead and coordinate the definition, documentation and testing of the application and data recovery plan. Manage relationships with software vendors and service providers. Develop / maintain a long-term life cycle plan for the ongoing maintenance and management of systems. Knowledge And Skills Cross platform hardware and software design and support at an advanced academic, pharmaceutical, biotech, or other scientific laboratory environment. Proven track record of implementing custom software and workflow solutions for process operations, data acquisition, sample management or lab analysis. Demonstrated experience with computerized manufacturing equipment, benchtop instrument and lab controller software/hardware troubleshooting and data integration. Working knowledge of administering and maintaining Microsoft operating systems, domains, databases as well as common browsers. Experience with GxP validation of equipment and computer related systems used in pharmaceutical processes. Experience in establishing controls to ensure GxP data integrity and the ability to guide use cases into best practices for raw data management and digital integration. Strong written and verbal communication, interpersonal and collaborative skills. jobTitle: Principal Scientific Associate - Process Chemistry, GMP Operations - Kilo Lab
jobDescription: Job Description The Manufacturing Operations Principal Scientific Associate, Kilo Lab Chemist performs the synthesis of test article for GLP toxicology studies, cGMP manufacture of APIs for early clinical trials from first in human (FIH) through proof of concept (POC), synthesis of API for formulation development and tech transfer development batches. Manufacturing is performed R&D or cGMP in glass and Hastelloy reactors ranging from 10 to 250-L using traditional organic chemistries. Batch sizes range from several hundred grams up to 10 kg. Key Duties And Responsibilities The responsibilities of this position may include, but are not limited to, the following: Responsible for the safe, compliant and timely cGMP manufacture of APIs for early phase development projects. Independently carry out development and scale-up activities for synthetically derived compounds, including raw materials, intermediates, and drug substances in support of cGLP or cGMP studies. Key collaborators are Quality Assurance, Release and Stability Lab/Analytical Development, Facility Operations and Engineering, Process Safety, Environmental Health Safety and Sustainability (EHSS), and Materials Management. Key customers are Process Chemistry and Engineering and Materials Sciences. Clean and maintain Kilo Lab equipment. Follow all SOPs and Wis and verbal instructions. Ensure compliance with all applicable regulations and SOPs and maintain excellent laboratory records and supporting documentation. Identify and troubleshoot problematic chemistry, scale-up and equipment issues. Generate effective scientific hypotheses to pursue desired synthesis or manufacturing goals and set new experimental direction based on results. Manage other Kilo Lab chemists. Performs other duties as assigned. Knowledge And Skills Ability to safely set up and perform kilo laboratory experiments Ability to read and follow chemistry Ability to read and understand synthetic chemistry journals and rightly apply to solving synthetic problems Ability to set up Kilo laboratory and get chemistry going Ability to understand cGMP manufacture and follow SOPs Ability to communicate results verbally and written and to exchange technical/scientific information. Able to work within a team and deliver within the team structure. Ability to run reactions in a lab making and isolating organic compounds at kilo lab scale. Education And Experience Bachelor's degree in relevant field BS with 5+ years, or an MS with 2+ years of relevant work experience. Hands on cGMP Kilo Lab or Pilot Plant manufacture. Synthetic organic chemistry of small molecules. API process development. Demonstrated understanding of common Kilo Lab equipment, processing methodologies, and best practices. Excellent verbal and written skills. The ability to successfully interact and collaborate within an interdisciplinary scientific team environment comprised of organic, physical, and analytical chemists; chemical engineers, project team members; and manufacturing personnel. Job Description Vertex is seeking a talented individual to join our small molecule Analytical Development group in Boston, MA. This individual will play a central role in advancing transformative medicines treating the underlying cause of serious diseases by leading analytical activities for small molecule development programs from preclinical through late-stage development. Job Description Position Description Vertex Pharmaceuticals, Inc., is seeking to hire a Temporary Research Scientist with experience in establishing and maintaining induce pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) and iPSC-based disease models. The successful candidate should be highly self-motivated, have outstanding technical and communication skills, and be capable of working independently on the design and execution of experiments. Above all, we are seeking a motivated and collaborative individual with a passion for stem cell biology and disease modeling who enjoys working in a fast-paced, highly collaborative team environment. jobTitle: Senior Director, Viral Vector Process Development
jobDescription: Job Description Senior Director, Viral Vector Process Development In June 2019, Vertex announced the establishment of a new research site in the Boston area where research, development, and clinical manufacturing for cell and genetic therapies will be primarily based. Cell and genetic therapies represent two rapidly emerging therapeutic modalities with the potential to treat—and even cure—several of the diseases Vertex is focused on, including sickle cell disease, Duchenne muscular dystrophy and type 1 diabetes. Further investment in a research site specifically designed to advance these programs will be key to Vertex’s continued and sustained leadership in these exciting approaches. At Vertex Cell and Genetic Therapies (VCGT) our research teams will bring together the best biology, technologies, and enhanced manufacturing capabilities to ensure we bring these cutting-edge transformative therapies to patients as quickly as possible. Vertex is seeking a Senior Director, Process Development, AAV Gene Therapy. The primary focus of this talented individual is to lead our AAV gene therapy process development/engineering team. jobDescription: Job Description Temporary Research Associate, Molecular & Cell Biology Vertex Pharmaceuticals is seeking a highly motivated Molecular Biologist to join our drug discovery team in San Diego. This position will focus on implementing molecular biology techniques to support ongoing and future genome editing research efforts towards the discovery and development of both small-molecule and genetic-based therapies. Job Description The Vertex Fellowship is a unique, one-year training program that provides didactic training and experiential learning about the science and business of drug discovery. The fellowship intends to attract outstanding scientists and physicians who have completed their PhD and/or MD degree within the previous 5 years. Fellows join Vertex for a customized yearlong experience in which they are embedded within project teams and gain hands‐on experience with real‐world R&D challenges. Fellows contribute to our culture of innovation by bringing their ideas to challenge our thinking. The program is directed by our Chief Scientific Officer, David Altshuler M.D., Ph.D., with the involvement of many other Vertex senior leaders. We believe diversity fuels innovation and encourage scientists from diverse backgrounds to apply for this fellowship. Early career scientists with expertise in a variety of research areas including but not limited to: Biology, Chemistry, Genetics, Gene Editing, Biochemistry, Formulation, Data Science, Toxicology, and Material Sciences are encouraged to apply. Why be a Vertex Fellow? Help patients by contributing to the development of transformative medicines Learn about drug discovery to build and accelerate your career Advance a scientific idea rapidly in a team‐based environment Receive mentorship from scientific, medical, and business leaders at Vertex Become a member of the Vertex Fellows network and develop connections internally and externally This program starts in September 2023 and ends August 2024. Minimum Qualifications Candidate must have earned a PhD, MD or joint degree Demonstrated evidence of scientific impact (e.g., through significant publications, presentations or awards) Demonstrated evidence of creative thinking and scientific problem solving Interest in the intersection of medicine and drug discovery research Fellows Program Timeline Applications for the Vertex Fellows 2023 - 2024 class will be accepted from November 14, 2022 ‐ January 13, 2023. Job Description Physician-scientists bring together the passion for solving a patient's unmet medical needs while pursuing scientific research that may one day translate into a clinical cure for a disease. We believe this distinctive combination of expertise, rigor and drive to positively impact human health is exactly what the biotechnology industry needs to serially innovate, and why we created the Vertex Physician Investigator Program. The Vertex Physician Investigator Program offers exceptional early career physician investigators, with a broad variety of backgrounds and experiences, full-time employment commencing with a unique two-year, immersive experience in which they complete four customized rotations. The program provides participants with a broad understanding of the drug development process and enables future leadership opportunities. Program participants will receive didactic training and experiential learning about the science and business of drug development.    This program is designed for outstanding early-career physician investigators with a proven track record of scientific and medical accomplishments and/or innovation in their field. Working within cross functional project teams, participants will contribute to solving real-world R&D problems while they learn about all areas of our business. The program is supported by and offers direct access to a multitude of Vertex Senior Leaders; this includes co-sponsorship by our Chief Scientific and Chief Medical Officers and leadership by our Head of Clinical Development for Vertex Cell and Gene Therapy. Program Details Full-time, benefitted position starting with a two-year rotation period consisting of four (4) six-month rotations: two mandatory rotations in Drug Discovery and Clinical Development plus two elective rotations in other Vertex functions of participant’s choice Intensive didactic training throughout the program A guided career path with Peer-to-Peer learning and mentorship from senior leaders at Vertex Upon completion of the two-year training, opportunity of placement in a mutually chosen, full-time role at Vertex Why be a Vertex Physician Investigator? Contribute to the development of transformative medicines for our patients Learn about drug development with a leading innovative biotech company Advance a scientific idea in a team-based environment Leverage both clinical and scientific expertise in a biotech setting Receive mentorship from scientific, medical and business leaders at Vertex Collaborate within cross-functional teams to drive innovation Accelerate career growth and broaden exposure to diverse opportunities Leadership development   The new class of VPI starts in Summer-Fall 2023 with placement on a Vertex team as the first rotation. jobDescription: Job Description General Summary: The Vice President, Regulatory & Quality Strategic Operations will be responsible for the design, build and implementation of the strategic business frameworks across the R&Q organizations with a focus on driving effective and efficient business results, operational rigor, and cross functional alignment.
